creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Found whilst playing with pid safety patches, noting so I don't forget:

mpm_common.c:reclaim_one_pid() does not do normal logging of children which exit
abnormally e.g. with SIGSEGV.  So if a child dies abnormally during shutdown or
just before, this isn't logged.  repro e.g.

kill -SEGV <childpid>; apachectl stop
